RES_SQLITE_MAX_LOOPS.

Definition at line 201 of file res_config_sqlite.c.

Referenced by cdr_handler(), config_handler(), load_module(), realtime_handler(), realtime_multi_handler(), and realtime_update_handler().

#define RES_SQLITE_MAX_LOOPS   10
 

Maximum number of loops before giving up executing a query. Calls to sqlite_xxx() functions which can return SQLITE_BUSY or SQLITE_LOCKED are enclosed by RES_SQLITE_BEGIN and RES_SQLITE_END, e.g. 

 char *errormsg;
 int error;

 RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
	 error = sqlite_exec(db, query, NULL, NULL, &errormsg);
 RES_SQLITE_END(error)

 if (error)
	 ...;

Definition at line 133 of file res_config_sqlite.c.

#define RES_SQLITE_VM_MAX   1024
 

Limit the number of maximum simultaneous registered SQLite VMs to avoid a denial of service attack.

Function Documentation

static int add_cfg_entry (  void *  arg,
int  argc,
char **  argv,
char **  columnNames
)  [static]
 

SQLite callback function for static configuration.

This function is passed to the SQLite engine as a callback function to parse a row and store it in a struct ast_config object. It relies on resulting rows being sorted by category.

Parameters:
arg a pointer to a struct cfg_entry_args object
argc number of columns
argv values in the row
columnNames names and types of the columns
Returns:
1 if an error occurred, 0 otherwise
See also:
cfg_entry_args

sql_get_config_table

static int add_rt_cfg_entry (  void *  arg,
int  argc,
char **  argv,
char **  columnNames
)  [static]
 

SQLite callback function for RealTime configuration.

This function is passed to the SQLite engine as a callback function to parse a row and store it in a linked list of struct ast_variable objects.

Parameters:
arg a pointer to a struct rt_cfg_entry_args object
argc number of columns
argv values in the row
columnNames names and types of the columns
Returns:
1 if an error occurred, 0 otherwise
See also:
rt_cfg_entry_args

static int add_rt_multi_cfg_entry (  void *  arg,
int  argc,
char **  argv,
char **  columnNames
)  [static]
 

SQLite callback function for RealTime configuration.

This function performs the same actions as add_rt_cfg_entry() except that the rt_multi_cfg_entry_args structure is designed to store categories in addition of variables.

Parameters:
arg a pointer to a struct rt_multi_cfg_entry_args object
argc number of columns
argv values in the row
columnNames names and types of the columns
Returns:
1 if an error occurred, 0 otherwise
See also:
rt_multi_cfg_entry_args

AST_MUTEX_DEFINE_STATIC (  mutex   ) 
 

The mutex used to prevent simultaneous access to the SQLite database. SQLite isn't always compiled with thread safety.

Asterisk callback function for static configuration.

Asterisk will call this function when it loads its static configuration, which usually happens at startup and reload.

Returns:

static size_t get_params (  va_list  ap,
const char ***  params_ptr,
const char ***  vals_ptr
)  [static]
 

Helper function to parse a va_list object into 2 dynamic arrays of strings, parameters and values.

ap must have the following format : param1 val1 param2 val2 param3 val3 ... arguments will be extracted to create 2 arrays:

  • params : param1 param2 param3 ...
  • vals : val1 val2 val3 ...

The address of these arrays are stored in params_ptr and vals_ptr. It is the responsibility of the caller to release the memory of these arrays. It is considered an error that va_list has a null or odd number of strings.

Parameters:
ap the va_list object to parse
params_ptr where the address of the params array is stored
vals_ptr where the address of the vals array is stored
Returns:
0 if an error occurred, the number of elements in the arrays (which have the same size) otherwise

Definition at line 783 of file res_config_sqlite.c.

References ast_log(), ast_realloc, free, and LOG_WARNING.

Referenced by realtime_handler(), realtime_multi_handler(), and realtime_update_handler().

00784 {
00785    const char **tmp, *param, *val, **params, **vals;
00786    size_t params_count;
00787 
00788    params = NULL;
00789    vals = NULL;
00790    params_count = 0;
00791 
00792    while ((param = va_arg(ap, const char *)) && (val = va_arg(ap, const char *))) {
00793       if (!(tmp = ast_realloc(params, (params_count + 1) * sizeof(char *)))) {
00794          free(params);
00795          free(vals);
00796          return 0;
00797       }
00798       params = tmp;
00799 
00800       if (!(tmp = ast_realloc(vals, (params_count + 1) * sizeof(char *)))) {
00801          free(params);
00802          free(vals);
00803          return 0;
00804       }
00805       vals = tmp;
00806 
00807       params[params_count] = param;
00808       vals[params_count] = val;
00809       params_count++;
00810    }
00811 
00812    if (params_count)
00813       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "1 parameter and 1 value at least required\n");
00814    else {
00815       *params_ptr = params;
00816       *vals_ptr = vals;
00817    }
00818 
00819    return params_count;
00820 }

static int load_config (  void   )  [static]
 

Load the configuration file.

This function sets dbfile, config_table, and cdr_table. It calls check_vars() before returning, and unload_config() if an error occurred.

Returns:
1 if an error occurred, 0 otherwise
See also:
unload_config()

01246    if (!(db = sqlite_open(dbfile, 0660, &errormsg))) {
01247       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", errormsg);
01248       free(errormsg);
01249       unload_module();
01250       return 1;
01251    }
01252 
01253    ast_config_engine_register(&sqlite_engine);
01254 
01255    if (use_cdr) {
01256       RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
01257          error = sqlite_exec_printf(db, "SELECT COUNT(id) FROM %Q;", NULL, NULL,
01258                                                  &errormsg, cdr_table);
01259       RES_SQLITE_END(error)
01260 
01261       if (error) {
01262          /*
01263           * Unexpected error.
01264           */
01265          if (error != SQLITE_ERROR) {
01266             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", errormsg);
01267             free(errormsg);
01268             unload_module();
01269             return 1;
01270          }
01271 
01272          RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
01273             error = sqlite_exec_printf(db, sql_create_cdr_table, NULL, NULL,
01274                         &errormsg, cdr_table);
01275          RES_SQLITE_END(error)
01276 
01277          if (error) {
01278             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", errormsg);
01279             free(errormsg);
01280             unload_module();
01281             return 1;
01282          }
01283       }
01284 
01285       error = ast_cdr_register(RES_SQLITE_NAME, RES_SQLITE_DESCRIPTION,
01286                                            cdr_handler);
01287 
01288       if (error) {
01289          unload_module();
01290          return 1;
01291       }
01292 
01293       cdr_registered = 1;
01294    }
01295 
01296    error = ast_cli_register(&cli_status_cmd);
01297 
01298    if (error) {
01299       unload_module();
01300       return 1;
01301    }
01302 
01303    cli_status_registered = 1;
01304 
01305    return 0;
01306 }

static struct ast_variable * realtime_handler (  const char *  database,
const char *  table,
va_list  ap
)  [static]
 

Asterisk callback function for RealTime configuration.

Asterisk will call this function each time it requires a variable through the RealTime architecture. ap is a list of parameters and values used to find a specific row, e.g one parameter "name" and one value "123" so that the SQL query becomes SELECT * FROM table WHERE name = '123';.

Parameters:
database the database to use (ignored)
table the table to use
ap list of parameters and values to match
Returns:
NULL if an error occurred, a linked list of struct ast_variable objects otherwise
See also:

static struct ast_config * realtime_multi_handler (  const char *  database,
const char *  table,
va_list  ap
)  [static]
 

Asterisk callback function for RealTime configuration.

This function performs the same actions as realtime_handler() except that it can store variables per category, and can return several categories.

Parameters:
database the database to use (ignored)
table the table to use
ap list of parameters and values to match
Returns:
NULL if an error occurred, a struct ast_config object storing categories and variables
See also:

static int realtime_update_handler (  const char *  database,
const char *  table,
const char *  keyfield,
const char *  entity,
va_list  ap
)  [static]
 

Asterisk callback function for RealTime configuration (variable update).

Asterisk will call this function each time a variable has been modified internally and must be updated in the backend engine. keyfield and entity are used to find the row to update, e.g. UPDATE table SET ... WHERE keyfield = 'entity';. ap is a list of parameters and values with the same format as the other realtime functions.

Parameters:
database the database to use (ignored)
table the table to use
keyfield the column of the matching cell
entity the value of the matching cell
ap list of parameters and new values to update in the database
Returns:
-1 if an error occurred, the number of affected rows otherwise

01112    char *query, *errormsg, *tmp_str;
01113    const char **params, **vals;
01114    size_t params_count;
01115    int error, rows_num;
01116 
01117    if (!table) {
01118       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Table name unspecified\n");
01119       return -1;
01120    }
01121 
01122    if (!(params_count = get_params(ap, &params, &vals)))
01123       return -1;
01124 
01125 /* \cond DOXYGEN_CAN_PARSE_THIS */
01126 #undef QUERY
01127 #define QUERY "UPDATE '%q' SET %q = '%q'"
01128 /* \endcond */
01129 
01130    if (!(query = sqlite_mprintf(QUERY, table, params[0], vals[0]))) {
01131       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate SQL query\n");
01132       free(params);
01133       free(vals);
01134       return -1;

01141          tmp_str = sqlite_mprintf("%s, %q = '%q'", query, params[i],
01142                                               vals[i]);
01143          sqlite_freemem(query);
01144 
01145          if (!tmp_str) {
01146             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to reallocate SQL query\n");
01147             free(params);
01148             free(vals);
01149             return -1;

01176    else

01180 
01181    sqlite_freemem(query);
01182

01184       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s\n", errormsg);
01185       free(errormsg);

char* sql_get_config_table [static]
 

Initial value:

"SELECT *"
"  FROM '%q'"
"  WHERE filename = '%q' AND commented = 0"
"  ORDER BY category;"
SQL query format to fetch the static configuration of a file. Rows must be sorted by category.
